edu.unm.health.biocomp.http

Class HtmUtils

  • Object
    • HtmUtils

  • public class HtmUtils
extends Object
    Static methods for web apps. Molfiles etc. are gzipped and base64ed by calling program.
    Author:
    Jeremy J Yang

      • headerHtm

        public static String headerHtm(String title,
               String js,
               String color)
        Header HTML with included JavaScript. (For use with JS + CSS via Apache.)

      • headerHtm

        public static String headerHtm(String title,
               List<String> jsincludes,
               List<String> cssincludes,
               String js,
               String color,
               HttpServletRequest request)
        Header HTML with included JavaScript. New: No more hard-coding of specific JS or CSS files in this function. Use jsincludes and cssincludes for all. Also no JS code here. If jsinclude|cssinclude bare filename (no '/'), prepend with conventional URL prefix, e.g. "/tomcat/biocomp/js". If path specified, then include unmodified (could be via Tomcat, httpd, or external URL).

      • headerHtm

      • PurgeScratchDirs

        public static boolean PurgeScratchDirs(String[] dirs,
                       int retire_sec,
                       boolean verbose,
                       String delim,
                       HttpServlet servlet)
        Deprecated .

      • PurgeScratchDirs

        public static boolean PurgeScratchDirs(List<String> dirs,
                       int retire_sec,
                       boolean verbose,
                       String delim,
                       HttpServlet servlet)
        For purging temporary files created by webapps (HttpServlet servlets), where the names indicate creation time. Note that timestamp is expected to be in format YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.
        Parameters:
        dirs - Directories to purge.
        retire_sec - How old files must be to purge.
        verbose - If true, log result to HttpServlet context.
        delim - Filename delimiter defining timestamp.
        servlet - HttpServlet calling object.
